attributes.action: Trevor McDonalds Comments on News Knight Thu 05 July 2007 23:00
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Dear Sir, 

I am deeply offended that in the 21st Century of Globalisation Sir Trevor MacDonald made a horrible harsh remark. The subject was that an Indian couple who were both doctors had a son who performed a successful operation on delivering a baby of a twenty year old mother, to which Sir Trevor's response was ' what is an indian boy doing surgery for, he should be stitching trainers ' I am disgusted by this remark and wish Sir Trevor to make a public apology or I will take this up further. 

Also children in India are excelling and developing at a faster rate and competing with people of the west in all high skilled areas such a science and technology is Sir Trevor knew his news properly then he would not have made this very unthoughtful comment. 

I have also forwarded this case to ofcomm and the BBC


Yours faithfully, 

Mr Vivek Davda

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
